page.title: 18LOCAL NEWSPAPER: REPORTER
page.content: {THE REPORTER }was first established on 14th May 1852 by Mr Thomes Blackie. Its present{circulation}is about {25,000.}In 1903 The Reporter was formed into a public company. It was called the 'Gravesend and Local' newspaper and in 1982 it's name was changed to the Reporter. The Reporter has 100 employees. The public tell the Reporter about their stories and send in pictures. It is{printed}on {Thursday.}They can accept stories right up to the time when it is published. The editor Mr K. Addison oversees everything that goes into the paper. He keeps a diary of coming events. There are{'telle add'}girls with special telephones to collect advertisements. A1K keyboards are used. They print 25,000 copies per week of between 48 and 64 pages.
